Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin-A. The Warp Conduit makes travel by warp possible by transferring power from the Warp Core to the Warp Engines. Newer conduits allow for a greater power transfer without endangering the Warp Core.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin-A. Warp Relays are the primary component of Warp Engines aboard the vast majority of Starships. They allow for the conversion of ionized Dilithium into energy.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin-A. A Warp Regulator is a relatively recent invention, created after a series of accidents involving NX class starships. It regulates the power flow from the Warp Core to the Engines.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin-A. A Warp Injector allows for ionized Dilithium to be inserted directly into the Warp Core, increasing power output by a wide margin. This should only ever be used in conjunction with proper Warp regulation.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin-A. The Warp Containment unit helps to contain energy leakage throughout the power transfer process. This reduces energy waste and allows for higher speeds during warp travel.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin-A. Mounted within the warp nacelles, the primary and secondary warp coils use the plasma generated by the warp core to create a subspace displacement field that allows for faster-than-light travel.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin-A. Warp Core is the common designation for the main energy reactor powering the propulsion system on warp-capable starships. More modern Warp Cores allow for greater speeds while not endangering the Warp Engines.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin. The Warp Conduit makes travel by warp possible by transferring power from the Warp Core to the Warp Engines. Newer conduits allow for a greater power transfer without endangering the Warp Core.
Resource spent to refresh the assignment list for away teams.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin. Warp Relays are the primary component of Warp Engines aboard the vast majority of Starships. They allow for the conversion of ionized Dilithium into energy.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin. A Warp Regulator is a relatively recent invention, created after a series of accidents involving NX class starships. It regulates the power flow from the Warp Core to the Engines.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin. A Warp Injector allows for ionized Dilithium to be inserted directly into the Warp Core, increasing power output by a wide margin. This should only ever be used in conjunction with proper Warp regulation.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin. The Warp Containment unit helps to contain energy leakage throughout the power transfer process. This reduces energy waste and allows for higher speeds during warp travel.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin. Mounted within the warp nacelles, the primary and secondary warp coils use the plasma generated by the warp core to create a subspace displacement field that allows for faster-than-light travel.

Can be used to upgrade the Warp Engine component of the USS Franklin. Warp Core is the common designation for the main energy reactor powering the propulsion system on warp-capable starships. More modern Warp Cores allow for greater speeds while not endangering the Warp Engines.
